intro: Mollia lepidota subsp. sphaerocarpa, commonly known as the woolly mollia, is a perennial shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are typically gray-green and covered in a fine layer of hair. This subspecies is well adapted to dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun.
